item.title: CoD Warzone: Best Sniper Rifles for Season 1
item.description:
The popularity of sniper rifles in Call of Duty: Warzone has peaked and troughed throughout the lifecycle of Call of Duty's battle royale. Despite featuring in the buffs and nerfs regularly, some remain the very best weapons to use in mid-range and long-distance duels on Urzikstan and Area 99.

The arrival of the Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 weapon arsenal gives players even more choice before dropping into the action. With so many sniper capable of making an impact on the battlefield, selecting the best one can be a tricky task. Here, find the very best Warzone sniper rifles to use in Season 1 of the battle royale.

Best Warzone Sniper Rifles For Season 1

The Warzone meta continues to change thanks to Raven Software's regular weapon balancing. For Season 1, there are a handful of sniper rifles that stand out from the crowd and suit all styles of play.

There are three snipers proving popular thanks to their superior performance. We've got all the intel on the strongest builds below:

LR 7.62

Up first is the LR 7.62, a bolt-action rifle that has the ability to eliminate an opponent in a single bullet due to its incredible firepower. The build that excels in the heat of battle manages to improve bullet velocity even further alongside additional accuracy enhancements and quicker reaction times:

  • Barrel : Reinforced Barrel
  • Laser : Target Laser
  • Rear Grip : Quickdraw Grip
  • Stock : Precision Pad
  • Fire Mod : 7.62 NATO Overpressured

LW3A1 Frostline

Another bolt-action rifle that's managed to stamp its authority on the Season 1 meta is the LW3A1 Frostline. Similar to the LR 7.62, the LW3A1 is perfect for players who prefer a passive style of play and picking off targets from afar. This build will keep locations concealed alongside increasing the rifle's one-shot potential:

  • Muzzle : Suppressor
  • Barrel : CHF Barell
  • Stock : Lightweight Pad
  • Comb : Quickdraw Riser
  • Fire Mod : 7.62 NATO Overpressured

Up to 87.5 meters, the LW3A1 Frostline has the possibility to score a one-shot kill which makes all the difference when attempting to eliminate squads in big-map battle royale and Resurgence matches. For fast reaction times, the Quickdraw Riser plays an integral role in guaranteeing a quick aim-down sight speed.

Victus XMR

A sniper rifle that's flown under the radar since the integration of the Call of Duty :Modern Warfare 2 arsenal is the Victus XMR. During the Al Mazrah era, the sniper excelled in mid and long-range battles thanks to strong damage output and impressive levels of mobility. The popularity of the rifle has surged following Black Ops 6 integration with this build providing phenomenal headshot damage range and bullet velocity to ensure drop-off doesn't impact performance:

  • Muzzle : VT-7 Spiritfire Suppressor
  • Barrel : Mack 8 33.5 Super
  • Optic : SP-X 80 6.6x
  • Stock : XRK Rise 50
  • Ammunition : .50 Cal High Grain Rounds

Players searching for the strongest sniper rifles to use in Call of Duty: Warzone have plenty of choice despite most of them featuring a bolt-action firing mechanism. The three picks above ensure players have plenty of firepower at their disposal alongside enough mobility not to get caught out by opponents with superior mobility.

item.title: One Piece: 7 Most Introverted Characters
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Characters like Robin and Law prefer solitude, adding depth and mystery to their personalities.
  • Killer and Katakuri are introverted, distant, and secretive due to past traumas and childhood experiences.
  • Shirahoshi isolates herself due to emotional struggles but takes steps to engage with the world.

The wide and wonderful world of One Piece is packed full of loud and extroverted characters, a prime example of which would be the series' protagonist, Monkey D. Luffy. However, as a testament to Eiichiro Oda's character writing, every individual in the world of One Piece possesses their own unique quirks and characteristics, with some being a lot more introverted than others.

Being an introvert doesn't necessarily mean these characters will outright refuse to spend time with others, but instead, can present introverted characteristics such as preferring to train alone or simply enjoying their own company in social situations. This can add relatability and a mysterious intrigue to these individuals that makes readers and viewers want to learn more about them.

7 Nico Robin

Robin Can Often Be Found Enjoying Her Own Company While Aboard The Sunny

  • First Appearance: 67

Compared to the rest of the Straw Hats crew, Robin is by far the most quiet and reserved of the bunch. During scenes that showcase the gang hanging out, Luffy, Usopp, and Chopper can always be seen getting up to mischief while Nami barks orders at them, but as for Robin, she'd prefer to sip on a cocktail and read a cozy book on the ship deck.

Robin is the type of person who can observe a situation without needing to say a word, and though Luffy has encouraged her to come out of her shell a bit more, she could still be considered one of the only introverts aboard the ship. Part of this could be a lingering effect from her tragic childhood where she was forced to sail away from Ohara Island all alone, experiencing true loneliness at such a young age.

6 Killer

Killer Prefers To Keep His Identity Hidden While Tearing His Enemies To Shreds

  • First Appearance: Episode 392

Killer, the right-hand man of Captain Eustass Kidd, isn't someone who enjoys making himself known to the world. In fact, Killer hides his face for the majority of the series, and barely ever speaks a line of dialogue, presenting him as a closed-off and introverted crew member who will only partake in combat when his captain tells him to do so.

During the events of Wano, Killer was forced to abandon his mask after consuming a SMILE fruit, causing him to experience a brief mental breakdown until Kid was able to get him back up to speed. Whether this will change Killer's personality, only time will tell, but many will always see him as that quiet assassin lurking in the background.

5 Sugar

Sugar Surrounds Herself With Toys That She Creates Through Her Devil Fruit

  • First Appearance: Episode 608

Sugar's Devil Fruit power allows her to turn ordinary citizens into toys, which causes them to be completely forgotten about by the people who once knew them. As a loyal member of Doflamingo's family, Sugar puts her fruit to good use by transforming anyone on the island of Dressrosa who steps out of line. As a result, she occupies a small area of Dressrosa where she can often be seen hanging around with toys rather than real people.

Compared to her other family members, Sugar seems to be much more docile and distant. At first, this may seem to make sense given that she's a little girl, but in actuality, Sugar is 22 years old, it's just that her Devil Fruit slows down the aging process to make her seem far younger than she actually is.

4 Shirahoshi

Shirahohshi's Emotional Instability Causes Her To Become Isolated From Her Family And Friends

  • First Appearance: 531

Ever since she was a child, Shirahoshi has always been known for being a character who struggles to control her emotions. As a result, she often decides to lock herself away from others, even after becoming a princess, so that she doesn't let her emotions spill out at every small inconvenience to irritate those around her.

Even upon meeting Luffy for the first time, Shirahoshi gets easily startled and even begins crying after he claims that he doesn't like her as a joke. With that being said, mustering up the courage to attend the Reverie was a huge step forward for Shirahoshi in being able to take on the responsibilities of being a princess and interacting with the wider world.

3 Zoro

Zoro Can Usually Be Found Training On His Own, Sleeping, Or Wandering Off On An Island

  • First Appearance: Episode 1

Similarly to Robin, Zoro isn't a straw hat who spends a lot of time socializing with the rest of the crew, unless a few bottles of sake are involved, of course. Instead, he can usually be found honing his sword skills on his own, or simply catching up on some sleep. Though he's always ready to help out his crew whenever needed, Zoro also isn't shy about walking around islands on his own and even partaking in a few fights along the way.

He's also a character who doesn't speak unless he feels he really needs to, such as when he feels the need to remind Luffy about his role as a captain. Zoro may not be the talkative type, but underneath the cold exterior is a deadly combatant who can easily slice any of the Straw Hats' enemies in two with a single strike.

2 Trafalgar D. Water Law

Law Acts More Like A Nomad Than A Pirate Crew Captain

  • First Appearance: Episode 392

In all honesty, it can be easy to forget that Law is the captain of his own pirate crew, considering that the guy acts like more of a nomad for much of the series. When he's not sneaking aboard the Straw Hat ship, Law is usually wandering around on his own, or with Bepo by his side, to understand the situation first-hand.

The tragic killing of Corazon, Law's closest friend, at such a young age may have pushed Law further into isolation, and while he's not above helping out those most deserving, he's far less rash and hotheaded about it than Luffy. He's also another character who tends to avoid partaking in too many social activities while aboard the Sunny.

1 Charlotte Katakuri

Katakuri's Childhood Has Made Him Far More Distant Than His Siblings

  • First Appearance: Episode 852

Unlike the majority of Big Mom's family, who are known for being loud and eccentric, Katakuri is instead much more quiet and reserved, preferring to let his fists do the talking for him. When he first shows up in the Whole Cake arc, Capone explains that Katakuri, despite seeming so mysterious and distant from his siblings, is secretly a 'monster' with some of the best Observation Haki seen up to that point.

Part of Katakuri's introverted nature comes from his childhood where other kids would constantly mock him for his large mouth, and his passionate love for donuts. This is why he not only covers his mouth with a scarf but also avoids people altogether, acting as more of a cold and calculated mercenary who always aims to take down Big Mom's latest enemies as quickly as possible without giving too much away about his identity or backstory in the process.

item.title: Genshin Impact: Chasca Team Composition Guide
item.description:
Chasca

Anemo

Bow

Natlan ( Tlalocan)

Guides

Ascension (coming soon)

Builds

Weapons

Team Comp

Constellation

Player Mistakes

Back to All Characters

Chasca is a unique Anemo DPS in Genshin Impact . What makes her different from all other Anemo units is her ability to deal multiple elemental DMG and being able to trigger most elemental reactions on her own. Its worth noting that other Anemo users are capable of triggering elemental reactions through their Swirls, but not as effective as Chasca since she shoots the needed elements and triggers their reactions.

Of course, with every great ability, there are great limitations, and Chascas mechanics are no different. In order to make the most of what she can offer, you have to team Chasca with the correct characters who will give her the elements she needs while increasing the teams DPS in general.

4 Chasca + Layla + Shenhe + Bennett

Pairing Layla and Shenhe in Chascas team triggers the Cryo Resonance, which gives the team an extra 15% Crit Rate against enemies affected by Cryo. This creates a chance to stack more Crit DMG on Chasca since she also gets a 40% Crit Rate from her Artifact set. When Chasca is paired with Cryo, Pyro, Hydro, and Electro units, she will load four shots of her gun with these elements when you use her Charge ATK during her Elemental Skill state.

Having two Cryo units in Genshin Impact alongside Bennett helps Chasca trigger more Melt DMG with her Elemental Skill. Whether its a Melt or a Reverse Melt depends on Chascas RNG when loading her weapon, although thats not important as long as Chasca is triggering those Melt reactions. Whats important is setting up Chasca with three Supports who will buff her DPS, since Layla, Shenhe, and Bennett, all have buffs in their kit other than their other Supportive utilities.

Team Role

  • Chasca: Main DPS
  • Layla: Support, shielder, buffer (C4 and Tenacity of the Millelith)
  • Shenhe: Support, buffer, debuffer
  • Bennett: Support, buffer, healer

3 Chasca + Shenhe + Furina + Bennett

Having Chasca teaming with Shenhe, Furina, and Bennett gives her a trio of the best Supports in Genshin Impact . Shenhe greatly increases her Cryo DMG as she shreds enemies resistance to Cryo and gives Chasca 15% extra Charged ATK DMG. On the other hand, Furina is one of the best buffers in Genshin Impact because of her Elemental Burst, which will give Chasca an insane amount of extra DMG. Moreover, Furina is a decent Sub-DPS with her Hydro summons that can deal some good off-field DMG. Finally, Bennett is always going to be an amazing buffer because of his raw ATK buff that takes Chascas DMG to the next level.

With all these buffs and Chascas ability to hit all three elements from her gun, she will be an unstoppable force that creates chaos based on the RNG of her shots. Chasca will either Freeze, Melt, or Vaporize enemies, or maybe do all three on every Charged ATK.

Team Role

  • Chasca: Main DPS
  • Shenhe: Support, buffer, debuffer
  • Furina: Sub-DPS, buffer, healer
  • Bennett: Support, buffer, healer

2 Chasca + Xiangling + Furina + Bennett

Xiangling is a character who has existed since the game's release. Yet, shes still one of the best Pyro units in Genshin Impact . Shes not only a good Sub-DPS, but can also buff Chascas Pyro DMG, reduce enemies' Pyro resistance, and grant Chasca a small ATK% buff from Guoba.

With Xiangling and Furina constantly applying their elements alongside Chascas elemental bullets, the team will keep triggering Vaporize reactions with high numbers, especially because of Bennett and Furinas buffs. Not to mention, having two Pyro units in the team will increase everyones ATK by 25%.

Team Role

  • Chasca: Main DPS
  • Xiangling: Sub-DPS, buffer, debuffer
  • Furina: Sub-DPS, buffer, healer
  • Bennett: Support, buffer, healer

1 Chasca + Sara + Ororon + Furina

Taking advantage of Melt and Vaporize can be fun, but Chasca can still operate outside these reactions. Giving the team of Chasca, Furina, and Ororon will allow them to trigger many Electro-Charged reactions with their off-field DPS.

As for Sara, shes there to trigger the Electro Resonance and help the team regenerate their Elemental Burst faster with her Elemental Skill. Kujou Sara is also an amazing Support who specializes in buffing ATK and maximizing the Electro DMG of a unit in her team, which is Chasca in this case.

Team Role

  • Chasca: Main DPS
  • Sara: Support, buffer, battery
  • Ororon: Sub-DPS, battery
  • Furina: Sub-DPS, buffer, healer

item.title: Genshin Impact: Chasca Constellation Guide
item.description:
Chasca

Anemo

Bow

Natlan ( Tlalocan)

Guides

Ascension (coming soon)

Builds

Weapons

Team Comp

Constellation

Player Mistakes

Back to All Characters

Constellations in Genshin Impact are important if players are looking to maximize a character they like. While Constellations mostly elevate characters and improve their limitations, they can sometimes be completely useless. In the case of Chasca, she's an Anemo character who manipulates different elements and suffers from some limitations to keep her from being overpowered.

One of Chascas biggest negatives is having to team her up with three of four specific elements, which greatly limits her DPS. Even more, if you are looking to include Chasca in a Hyperbloom or a Burning team in Genshin Impact , youll have to include a Dendro unit in her team, which means losing a decent chunk of her DMG.

Are Chascas Constellations Worth It In Genshin Impact?

Yes, Chascas Constellations are worth it in Genshin Impact . Some of her Constellations negate her limitations while others add more DMG to her already strong kit. If youre looking to invest in Chascas Constellations, go for C2 Chasca as the first two Cons completely negate her limitations.

C1 - Cylinder, the Restless Roulette

  • Effect: When triggering the Passive Talent Bullet Trick's Spiritbinding Conversion, the 2nd Shadowhunt Shell loaded into the cylinder will be additionally converted into a Shining Shadowhunt Shell. The chance to trigger Spiritbinding Conversion is increased: If there are party members who meet the Elemental Conversion Type requirements, the chance to trigger Spiritbinding Conversion is increased by 33.3%, up to a maximum of 100%. You must first unlock the Passive Talent Bullet Trick. In addition, Chasca's Nightsoul point and Phlogiston's consumption in her Nightsoul's Blessing state decreased by 30% while out of combat.
  • Importance: High

The effect of C1 Chasca increases her chances of loading an elemental bullet other than Anemo by around 33%. This means Chasca can be more versatile when it comes to building her team since you only need two characters of the four elements she scales with. Youre still losing a little DMG, but her first Constellation opens the door to include characters like Nahida or Xilonen, who can easily give more than what Chasca is losing.

C2 - Muzzle, the Searing Smoke

  • Effect: When Chasca takes the field, she will obtain 1 stack of Spirit of the Radiant Shadow from the Passive Talent Bullet Trick. You must first unlock the Passive Talent Bullet Trick for this effect. In addition, when the Shining Shadowhunt Shells from Spirit Reins, Shadow Hunt's Multitarget Fire hit opponents, they will deal AoE Elemental DMG of the corresponding Elemental Type of the Shining Shadowhunt Shells equal to 400% of Chasca's ATK. This DMG is considered Charged Attack DMG. This effect can be triggered once each time Chasca uses Multitarget Fire.
  • Importance: Priority

C2 Chascas passive effect finishes what C1 started. Now, Chasca doesnt even lose DMG when paired with a character who doesnt belong to the four elements she scales with. You can safely build Chascas team with two of the specific elements while reserving a place in the team for any character you want.

C4 - Sparks, the Sudden Shot

  • Effect: When the Radiant Soulseeker Shells from Soul Reaper's Fatal Round hit opponents, they will restore 1.5 Elemental Energy to Chasca, and deal AoE Elemental DMG of the corresponding Elemental Type of the Radiant Soulseeker Shells equal to 400% of Chasca's ATK. This DMG is considered Charged Attack DMG. The aforementioned corresponding elemental AoE DMG effect can be triggered once each time Chasca uses Soul Reaper's Fatal Round.
  • Importance: Medium

Having C4 Chasca get her Elemental Burst back quicker isnt really a game changer, since she doesnt depend on it for DMG as much as she depends on her Elemental Skill, or Charged ATK to be specific. The nice thing about her fourth Constellation is adding a new attack that scales with her Charged ATK DMG, which is good for Chasca, but not when youre spending a lot of Primogems on getting that C4.

C6 - Showdown, the Glory of Battle

  • Effect: Chasca's Multitarget Fire charge time is decreased, and after the Passive Talent Bullet Tricks Spiritbinding Conversion is triggered, Chasca will gain the Fatal Rounds state: For the next 3s, the next time Chasca uses Spirit Reins, Shadow Hunt's Multitarget Fire, the shots will finish charging instantly, and the CRIT DMG of that instance of Multitarget Fire increases by 120%. 1 Fatal Rounds effect can be gained once every 3s. You must first unlock the Passive Talent Bullet Trick to gain access to the above effect.
  • Importance: Priority

C6 Chasca is a one-man army thats capable of dealing an insane amount of DMG each time you press her Elemental Skill. With her C6 Constellations passive, Chasca instantly shoots enemies another time after she finishes her charging, buffing that shot by an extra 120% Crit DMG. For her fans who are looking to invest heavily in Chasca, her C6 is a big jump in DPS.

item.title: Honkai: Star Rail Reveals First Remembrance Character For Version 3.0
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Aglaea is a new 5-star character in Honkai: Star Rail's Version 3.0, following the Path of Remembrance.
  • Version 3.0 will debut on January 15, taking players to the fourth planet, Amphoreus, inspired by Greek and Roman mythology.
  • Aglaea's design, as a Dressmaster, hints at a potential gameplay mechanic where she may summon mannequins as combat servants.

Honkai: Star Rail has revealed the 5-star character Aglaea for Version 3.0, who is also the first Path of Remembrance character in the game. The character will be playable in Honkai: Star Rail 's next major arc, along with The Herta.

Honkai: Star Rail Version 3.0 will reportedly come out on January 15, and will signal the start of Trailblazer's adventure to the fourth planet, Amphoreus. Rumors suggest that Amphoreus might be inspired by Greek and Roman mythology, which could also influence the design of the environment and characters.

The reveal of Aglaea seems to confirm the Greek and Roman influences, in part because she's wearing a white and gold dress that's similar to a toga. According to Honkai: Star Rail 's tweet, Aglaea is a 5-star Lightning-type Honkai character following the Path of Remembrance, and she's also the Dressmaster of Okhema and one of Amphoreus' Chrysos Heirs.

Name and Star Level

Aglaea (5-star)

Element and Path

Lightning, Path of Remembrance

Release Date

Version 3.0 (January 15, 2025)

In the replies, many fans were surprised that Honkai: Star Rail revealed a new Path, especially since Remembrance is only available as a Blessing in the Simulated Universe. Others also expressed their struggle with choosing between The Herta and Aglaea in Honkai: Star Rail Version 3.0's banner.

What Does Aglaea Being a Remembrance Character Mean For Honkai: Star Rail?

It's been rumored for a while that Honkai: Star Rail will introduce the new Path of Remembrance in Version 3.0, with the Trailblazer possibly adopting it for their next form. Some leakers suggest that Remembrance characters will have the unique ability of summoning "servants," who have their own set of attacks and skills on the battlefield. Considering that Aglaea is a dressmaker and her splash art features mannequins, it's possible that she might be able to summon one or multiples of them to aid her in combat. HoYoverse has yet to confirm the servant mechanic, but if it's true, it will be the first time that Honkai: Star Rail will incorporate this into its gameplay. It will definitely be interesting to see how the mechanic could shift the meta and affect team compositions in Version 3.0 and beyond.

Meanwhile, Honkai: Star Rail fans will have to wait until December for the official Version 3.0 Special Program stream, which will tease the next Trailblaze Continuance Missions, Amphoreus' locations, and Aglaea and The Herta's full kit. It might even showcase other playable characters that will come out in the next few months of 2025.
